aircraft.value: Medusa Strike - AC-2551-743 at Central Command Hub

defect_observed.value: Compressor stall during acceleration. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.

root_cause.value: Vibration induced loosening of mechanical fasteners

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fuel Injection component. Testing confirmed performance below acceptable limits.

corrective_action.value: Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation

preventive_action.value: Issue technical bulletin to all operators

remarks_investigation.value: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.

remarks_design.value: Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate. Date: 07/03/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type. Date: 09/03/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations. Date: 10/03/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions. Date: 14/03/2023 Signature: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type. Date: 17/03/2023 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer

FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Compressor stall during acceleration. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Vibration induced loosening of mechanical fasteners
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fuel Injection component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Issue technical bulletin to all operators
d) Attributable Code: F - Failure/ageing/Corrosion/Material Failure
